title: Why can’t I seem to write anything even when I have motivation to do it? I have ideas, and I have a very strong motivator, but I just can’t seem to do it. Is there a way to fix this? - Quora

response.answer_text: If I had to guess, I’d say you fear judgement of others, which is why you’re holding yourself back. Just write. Start writing every day. I suggest finding someone like Seth Godin who is an author but he provides great information for those starting out. At first, just commit to writing some quantity of words per day - 500, 1000, or whatever. Pick a topic and write about it. Make it a daily habit to write and you’ll find that your confidence will grow and you’ll build it into your daily routine. Build your confidence and you’ll be less apprehensive.

Hi, Just start writing. Yes it’s as simple as that. It might seem like rubbish that you’ve written but guess what…it’s your rubbish. The more you write the more confident you’ll get and before too long you’ve got a story. Writing is hard work and anything good to create doesn’t happen on the first attempt. Keep going. Hope that helps.
